alert.note: Alert for Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Columbia and Suwannee Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 519 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Columbia, or 10 miles north of Ichetucknee Spring, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Suwannee Springs, Ichetucknee Spring, Columbia, Fort White, Wellborn, Obrien, Mcalpin, Branford and Hildreth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
